conbody.p: A “device path” is defined as the communication path from Field Communications Server to the physical network to which a field communication device is connected. It identifies the hardware that the device(s) are connected to, such as the FCS, I/O module, modem, multiplexer etc. Device paths need to be defined on a Field Communications Server for it to recognize your hardware configurations and be able to communicate with your devices.

The following figure illustrates an example of three FF-H1 devices connected to the Field Communications Server through the I/O modules on two separate FCSs. In this example, each of the devices is located on a separate device path, as they are connected via different I/O modules and FCSs.
